name: Li Seng Heng
introduction: Li Seng is the founder of Green Nudge, a social enterprise that supports businesses and communities to achieve positive environmental impact through activities such as coastal cleanups and workshops, outreach talks and sustainability consulting. By raising awareness and co-creating call-to-actions with various stakeholders on sustainability efforts, Green Nudge aims to create a normative shift in the way we create and deal with waste to achieve a low carbon, zero waste future for Singapore.
top_3_advice: Context matters. Singapore has its own unique problems and solutions. While it is important to share or educate employees about broader sustainability challenges, it is equally important to recognise the context of the issue in Singapore.

Data gets your message across. Getting buy-in from stakeholders can be difficult if they do not understand the problem you are facing. Establishing a baseline for data collection helps to paint a more objective picture in order to kickstart any sustainability discussion and initiative.

Plan with the future in mind. While kickstarting engagement and initiatives within your organisation is important, it also helps to establish a medium to long-term plan that includes funding and managerial support.
how_can_help: Offering tips and advice based on past experiences working with public, private and people stakeholders.
Sharing past successful and unsuccessful case studies so that we can collectively learn and grow together.
Providing insights and views on upcoming trends in the green corporate social responsibility movement in companies in Singapore.
green_nudge_origin: Started in 2018 initially as an initiative by tapping on a grant to ensure that events were held in a sustainable manner. Motivated by observations of poor waste disposal habits among office workers in Central Business District and large amount of food wastage at eateries.
business_model: For-profit and for-impact entity through social enterprise model by providing events and services for a fee to ensure long-term sustainability rather than relying on donations.
marine_debris_impact: 15,000 kg of trash collected by informal groups over 2 months each year, excluding formal cleaning services. Marine debris affects Singapore significantly as country surrounded by water.
challenges_overcome: Convincing clients about value of facilitated educational cleanups vs volunteer-driven activities
Persuading event organisers that proper waste management affects branding
Getting SMEs to consider sustainability beyond direct profit margins
learning_module_rationale: Ensure participants leave with more than good feeling of picking up trash. Drive home message that sustainability efforts can start from homes, lives or offices. Share historical and cultural values of cleanup sites and relationship between actions and environmental impact.
most_proud_of: Leveraging non-sustainability background to offer objective take on Singapore issues. Playing middleman role connecting various stakeholders to create lasting conversations and shape long-term positive practices towards sustainability.
previous_experience: Public sector experience in central bank of Singapore dealing with financial regulations
singapore_context_expertise: Understanding Singapore's unique waste management processes (incineration vs landfill) to better apply sustainability principles locally
tri_sector_approach: Interfacing role within public, private and people sectors with systems thinking lens for informed decisions and strategies
